intro: Paratropia elliptica var. ovata, commonly known as the oval-leaf paratropia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, ovate leaves that are often hairy beneath. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
